ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you have the chance to take Macro with Professor Love you should definitely do it! You will come out a better economist with a thorough and intuitive understanding of macroeconomic theory.

This is a great course if you want to understand global economies, their interactions and the major crises and issues we face today. It will prepare you to evaluate macroeconomic activity in your future and that is invaluable
It gives you the ability to have a conversation about the macroeconomy with a friend and have a basic understanding of current conditions.
recommend
A class where you will learn a lot.
Not to be missed!

If you want an in-depth overview of applied macroeconomics, this is the ideal course for you. You learn interesting theory and practical models to apply that theory to some of the most relevant economic occurrences in the world today.
Same as above
It was a great course
A fast-paced introduction to everything macro.
One of the best courses I've taken at Yale.
Reasonable
I would strongly like recommend this course. It covers a wide range of macroeconomic models, and while it does not go into much detail in each, you will learn a lot.
I would recommend the course highly.

Assuming the format is similar in future years, it's a course you should want to take whether it's compulsory or not - gives a great overview of practical applied economics in the current global context.

ECON 546 01 is an integral part of the IDE program. It allows you to, regardless of your initial level of proficiency, understand important macroeconomics concepts that would be useful wherever you go - be it in research, academia, or policy work. Highly, highly recommend this course and I'm glad this is a core requirement for the IDE program!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course really deepened my understanding of economics in an applied sense. Ive taken a lot of econ classes that focus too much on theory and youre unable to see it applied in the real world. But Dukes managed to really draw it all together and it was thoroughly interesting
learn a lot about the thinking method
Taught me the practical skills I need to know to understand applied macroeconomics.

This course gave me a practical understanding of macroeconomics, that will enable me to apply my knowledge to my future career and everyday life (e.g. when reading the news, discussing current events).
Yes.
Gave good overview of macro + exciting areas within the field
Will help in a general sense to understand macro conditions in the world economy. Very useful for having an understanding of whats going on around you
It helped me to understand a different branch of econ.
Yes, very helpful for deepening my knowledge and developing my dissertation.
The course definitely helped contribute to my research, it was actually vital to my research.
It gave a really helpful overview of issues helpful to any aspiring international policymaker.

It not only deepened by knowledge of macroeconomics, it made me more interested in macroeconomics and has allowed me to better appreciate what is happening in the world and also understand economic news better. Now I know what the Fed is trying to do when they delay raising the Fed rates and how the Bank of Japan is constricted (hitting the zero lower bound of nominal interest rates) when facing stagflation. Amazing course!
